"Rise and shine, Mister Freeman. Rise and... shine."
- G-Man

Half-Life 2 is by many claimed to be one of, if not the best, game ever made. When I started playing Half-Life 2 I was a bit sceptical for if the game could live up to it, but I can now happily say Half-Life 2 didn't disappoint me.

Like the original Half-Life, Half-Life 2 is a well made game, with a lot of attention to detail and gameplay, I'm still amazed by the fact that the magnifying glass in Dr. Kleiner's lab actually works.

Half-Life 2 is more story driven than to originally Half-Life, the story is great but unfortunately you may have to have played the originally Half-Life to fully understand the story.

The gameplay is fun and enjoyable, each chapter of Half-Life 2 attempts to try something new gameplay wise so it doesn't get too repetitive. The gunfights are fun, and the Gravity-Gun and the ability to throw big heavy objects at enemies is a nice fun addition, that makes Half-Life 2 stand out from other FPS games.

Overall Half-Life 2 is great experience, and definitely lives up to the claims to be one of the best games ever made, and is worth its price tag.

Pretty good, but I'm not sure it lived up to ALL the hype. But I understand, since many people call this the greatest PC game of all time. For 2004, it is amazing what this game was able to accomplish. However my main problem is that it's too much of the same thing the entire game. It's just a run-and-gun kinda thing. The storyline is entertaining, but the actual gameplay lacks in variety. The ending, however, was really worthwhile, and I enjoyed the last cutscene, although I was certainly confused initially. 

AND THE RPG IS SOOOOOO BROKEN. YOU FIRE AT THE ENEMY IT MAKES A U-TURN AND INSTANTLY KILLS YOU. Most frustrating thing in the entire game. 

Other than that it's a a good game. 8.5/10

The finest game the world has ever known.

I can't believe I held off so long until actually playing this. This is one amazing game. Storytelling, check. Weapon balance, check. Characters that don't fall into stereotypes (save one or two that came from the original half life), check. Good balance between hard segments and being to be able to do it, check. Having luck factor in gameplay (gunplay relies on luck sometimes), check.

I can now understand why people are clamoring for Half-Life 3. A good story deserves a great ending. 

Plays great with an Xbox gamepad, by the way (I can't play FPS with keyboard and mouse as I suffer from my tendons, so being able to play a game with a gamepad is a must for me).

I don't normally write reviews but, after playing 45+ hours and completing all the achivements, I think its about time to write one.

If you are into FPS games or RPGs, then this game is for you. It has amazing storytelling and music.The graphics imo still look amazing especially for when it was released.  Never gets boring, not even for a second. If you have doubts about this game, just look at the reviews (currently overwhelmingly positive).

I was liking it until I got into a puzzle where it seemed that I was supposed to pile up some boxes in order to make a ladder in order to escape from a lower-level spot.
It got so frustrating. I tried everything, and nothing (see update). I even tried enhancement codes (a.k.a " cheats"), in order to boost the character¬¥s suit, so that he could perform a simple jump.
No deal, and worse, after I used the cheats, the character wouldn¬¥t move.
I spent one hour and a half of my life trying to get rid of that situation. I might resort to a video walkthrough, but I don¬¥t know about that; I barely started the effing game, it was all going so well, it wasn¬¥t supposed to get so hard so early.

UPDATE: I just watched a walkthrough and will continue playing. But be careful, it¬¥s deceiving. I¬¥m never gonna have my one and a half hour back

UPDATE 2: far too many puzzles than I¬¥d like. It goes like this: walk through filthy tunnel=>solve an irritating puzzle=>shoot opressing soldiers=>shoot opressing drones=>walk through another filthy tunnel, this time with underwater sections and ladders=>solve an irritating puzzle=>repeat

UPDATE 3: now I¬¥m starting to get the hang of it. I¬¥m starting to figure out more quickly what must be done in each puzzle (yes, they¬¥re still there). And some sections of the game are (well, at least one) quite thrilling, I have to admit. And considering the gameplay is fluid, the shotting mechanism is good, and the game never crashes, I¬¥m starting to understand why this game receives so much love.

UPDATE 4: level design, although inventive, lacks what I call dramatic progression. You are always alternating epic, dramatic shooting and underground, puzzle grinding.
it goes like this:
Me: Wow, that¬¥s pretty epic. Maybe this is the final level.
Game: Nah, you¬¥re wrong. Here, have some more unimportant puzzles in a depressive tunnel maze.

CONCLUSION: i recommend it, because it¬¥s obvious it¬¥s a good game in all aspects. But I myself don¬¥t intend to play it again - heck, not even finish it.

P.S.: I finished the game. The last level game me some thrilling feeling. That¬¥s more than I can say for most games. Although the very ending is rather disappointing and not movie-like at all, I still recommend this game. My job here is done.

This game still blows my mind to this very day, Valve managed to capture lightning in a bottle and it doesn't look like it will ever happen again. I hate what they've become, but before their slow decline into Steam sales and mediocrity, through blood, sweat and tears they created something that still resonates with people to this very day. That's an achievement that they will be remembered for many years to come.

Excelent game, a real masterpiece. Contains action, puzzles, and a really interestig story. The graphics and the effects are nice. I hope the next game will be released soon... Best game on my library.
